textPlain: ThisÂ really shouldn't get the fundamental point wrong> When an employee exercises an option, the company must issue a new share of stock that can be publicly traded.No. When you exercise, you get the stock, but it's definitely not guaranteed to be publicly traded.For example Graphcore gave people options, which if exercised became stock in graphcore.
